comment: amazing professor. only halfway through this semester. i wish he would teach GOV and US HISTORY.
Lectures are Interesting. Professor is Funny. Test are INCREDIBLY HARD!! So STUDY STUDY STUDY!!! Depending on the People you Have in the class will help the learning process!!!
Great Teacher- Very helpful. Tests are easy as long as you pay attetion in class! He goes fast through the lecture, but as long as you can keep up you will be good.

Zander is awesome. His lectures are fun - almost like he is just telling a story. He gives great study guides before each test, so you know exactly what will be on it. He's really passionate about the subject. He takes attendance for a participation grade, but it's not mandatory if you do well on everything else. It sucks that he's leaving KSU.

This is the best teacher I have ever had.  Other teachers need to learn how to teach from him.  His classes are actually fun and I was really disappointed the day I had to miss his class for personal reasons.  He makes it crystal clear as to what you need to know and learn.  I strongly recommend taking his classes for all history requirements.

I loved professor Zander!!!  He is a great teacher!  The entire class consists of him lecturing the whole time but he is funny and makes history very interesting.  There were 3 tests and 3 quizzes but he tells you beforehand what is going to be on them.  Definitely an easy A if you put in a little effort and go to class.  Overall a GREAT TEACHER

Great class!! I've always been interested in History and he kept my interest going! Only 3 tests and 3 quizzes.very easy. His study guides are helpful.Only negative is he does not post grades on Vista though, and is not quick to give them back. Just take notes!!
Great Professor! Attend and take notes on lecture and the exam is EASY! Gives a study guide but need the notes to complete! Don't need the book if you attend the lecture! 3 exams and 3 quizzes.
Loved this class, even at 8am. His lectures are like him telling a story. Tests were average.

Zander is a great history professor and I would definitely recommend taking him. He is funny and makes the lectures interesting. If you go to class and take notes you do not need to buy the book. He gives study guides for tests which are not hard if you have the notes.

LOVED THE CLASS AND THE PROF!! I dislike history with a passion unseen before and he made this class so interesting and alive for me. Never a dull moment and he really knows what he's talking about it. The tests are a little difficult and you NEED to study, and NOT CRAM. You have to read two extra books outside of class but they aren't difficult.
AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!! BEST CLASS I'VE EVER HAD. HE IS AWESOME. Its like going to class for story time. And I ACTUALLY learned stuff and i talk about it. EASY A, EASY A. TAKE HIM

I felt like every class was story time! His lectures are interesting and leave you wanting to know more! Normally I forget everything I learn after a test but even now that I am out of class I think I remember enough that I could pass every one of his tests without studying! Take Him!You will love history!

He's goofy and says a lot of things that are inappropriate and have nothing to do with the material that you will be tested on. The class is extremely easy if you listen and take notes during lecture. The book isn't needed, just show up and study.
Approachable, goofy, great at explaining history. Learned lots and felt encouraged to learn more. Class is everything I could ask for - entertaining, fulfilling, but certainly not exhausting.

TAKE HIM! professor zander is not only super easy.. he is actually pretty interesting.  Have to go to class! Take notes and look over them the night before and you will make an A.  Has 3 tests and 3 quizzes over books that he assigns which page numbers to read.. id take him again if he taught 2112! highly recommended!

This was a pretty easy class and he likes to joke around :) Attendance isnt mandatory. He just lectures and you have to take notes. He posts a study guide that has everything you need to know. Just study that and you'll do good
Zander is da Mander!

Zander is awesome! He has a goofy/corny sense of humor, but it makes the class interesting. You can tell he really loves History. His class is purely lecture, so make sure you show up for class! Attendance is not mandatory, but it is better if you show up. Don't even bother buying the book... You can make an A on the test without it.

Zander is a nice guy and he likes history alot and he isnt completely boring.  Class is all lecture so be ready to write!! He give out length study guide but they tell you everything that will be on test. Must come to class and take notes to get and A.

If I wasn't already decided and i knew Zander would teach every course, i would be a history major. Amazing! couldn't ask for a better history teacher. Actually was interested in his lecture. you can tell he is truly excited about what he is teach. i retained just about everything and got an A! i'm telling you take this teacher!!!!
Awesome Teacher! Gives awesome clear and precise notes when teaching and gives awesome study gudes and also just study and take notes and attend class you should get an A

Great class, Zander has a great personality and is very willing to help..makes lectures very clear and precise, and knows a vast amount of the subject. pay attention in class take some notes and study, it is college, and you will do fine in this class. take Zander.

The absolute BEST professor I've had thus far. He gives you ALL of the information  you need to pass the test. The study guides are very helpful. Prof. Zander KNOWS what he's talking about and makes it very interesting. Easiest history class I've ever taken, and I actually REMEMBER what he's taught! TAKE HIM!

Zander is the BEST Professor! He's funny and intelligent and really helpful. I missed 2 quizzes and he let me make them both up, no questions asked. The tests are challenging but not hard, use the study guide and you'll be fine. DO NOT BUY THE BOOK!! The only book you need is the De Las Casas book, he never used the others.

I have always despised history, but prof Zander has made world history so enjoyable. I learned so much! Attend class and take notes, highly advise never missing a class. MC exams and a few reading assignments. The absolute best history teacher I have ever had! A+

Prof. Zander was an awesome professor! He goes through a lot of material, so missing class is not recommended! He is passionate about his subject, and incredibly helpful to his students. NO PAPERS! Don't bother with the book.

Great teacher and not dry lecture.  Don't need the book, but do need to take notes to pass easily.  Not a fan of history but he made it interesting. Would love to take another history class with him if needed.
He's great! I highly recommend him and he will help you with anything. He's lectures are easy to understand and his tests come straight from his lectures. Loved the class!

TAKE HIS CLASS! Zander is honestly the BEST history teacher at KSU. He is extremely passionate about his subject and makes the class lectures super interesting. You take your own notes and tests are very simple and easy. DO NOT BUY THE BOOK.

do NOT buy the text book!  he teaches his class in a totally different way, more like story mode!  take LOTS of notes because his tests are from notes!  He is an AWESOME TEACHER!! GREAT PERSONALITY AND FUN TO LISTEN TOO! he did require a paper but its not too bad! RECOMMEND HIM!! BUT PAY ATTENTION
DO NOT BUY THE BOOK. DO NOT BUY THE BOOK. DO NOT BUY THE BOOK. Easy and nice.
Zander is a great teacher makes the class fun and the information easy to remember. One of my favorite profs at KSU!

He is the best history teacher!!!! The material is a little dull but hes so funny! You have to attend every class though bc his tests are based on lecture! His tests are fairly easy and the quizzes are easy too. I highly recommend him!!! dont buy the book bc you wont need it.

I took a class I had previously dropped with another professor. There is a lot of information, but Dr. Zander is the best history professor I've ever had, and I learned more from him than I had probably learned in 13 years of history classes combined.

If you are a visual learner, this is the class for you! He uses historic photos, charts, and maps. Barely any words on the screen. He truly brings it to life! Instead of teaching as if everything happened "in a vacuum," he connects events. SIGN UP!

amazing professor! I used to hate history prior to taking this class, but he made it so interesting. You can tell he really loves teaching the material. Be sure to attend each class and take good notes. Study the study guides and all the key words and you'll be good for the test. And DON'T BUY THE TEXT BOOK! -waste of money, we never used it.
Great Professor. Go to class take notes and use the study guide. You lots of cool information which makes class fun as well. Take him if you have the chance.

AWESOME. really easy. go to class and take notes, look them over before tests and you will be fine. Doesn't use book, straight lecture. If not auditory learner would def suggest someone else because he just lectures the entire class. But funny and awesome nonetheless

Very nice man. Very clear and very easy. Show up for class, take good notes, fill out the study guides and you'll be fine. He's very helpful if you get stuck on something. Don't need to buy any of the books, he'll even tell you that in class. You can find the short readings online and you never need the textbook. GREAT TEACHER!!!!!!!!!

He is awesome! He loves this subject and is very passionate about it. All you need to do is to show up to every class, show respect and take really detailed notes. He doesn't mind if you record his lectures either. I took notes, and then reviewed them every few days and I got 100s in his class
WONDERFUL!! Great lectures, nice man. Will make a point of knowing your name and engaging the class. Easy tests: take good notes. SIGN UP SIGN UP SIGN UP!

Great professor, enjoys what he teaches. Tests and quizzes were a mixture of lectures and info on book. Summer class: 2 exams & 2 quizzes. Counted both exams, but dropped both quizzes if they hurt your avg... :) ***TAKE NOTES RELIGIOUSLY IN THIS CLASS***

He is a wonderful teacher and the class is very simple, just come to class and take notes answer the study guide and you cannot go wrong. You learn so much and even though none of the tests are cumulative during the lectures he still connects previous information. The class was like story time at the library. Textbook not needed.

This is a very easy class if you go to class and take notes. He makes most lectures pretty interesting, and you can tell he really loves history. His study guides are long, but if you take notes and do the study guide you'll do great. Oh and don't waste money on textbook.

Extremely passionate about the material, clear instructions, easy tests. He made me want to be a history major. He's super nice and really tries to get to know his students. You won't regret taking his class. And oh, don't buy the textbook.

VERY GOOD TEACHER. Writes terms on board. Explains them. Class is not mandatory, but you NEED to come to class to take notes. Very interesting lectures. Easy to understand. DO NOT NEED TO BUY THE TEXTBOOK. You do need to read "Communist Manifesto", but you can always read it online for FREE. (That's what I did) Study his notes and you will ACE!!!!

Professor Zander was absolutely amazing. I'm very sad the class is over. You have to go to class to take the notes, but he makes history like one big giant story. He makes it actually very interesting to learn. He has 3 tests (no cumulative final), 3 quizzes, and a simple participation grade. Easy A if you come to class and take notes. take him!!!!

Just a fantastic History teacher. He gives excellent,detailed lectures. Doesn't stray from it and stays on schedule. Yet,he doesn't ever really get boring. Dry sense of humor. I was planning on majoring in History,and he reaffirmed my love for it. Take him,you won't regret it.

Dr. Zander rocks! He tells you exactly what you need to do to pass his class. Very interesting lectures that last the whole class period. Text not mandatory. MUST TAKE NOTES to pass his mult choice tests. You actually learn in his class.

Dr. Zander is excellent.  He is clearly passionate about the material, and he loves to teach.  He is personable to students.  His lectures are interesting, but you need to attend class.  No need to buy the books.  He gives a study guide and makes all the material for the tests really clear. Definitely take him.

So easy and an awesome teacher! 3 multiple choice tests (with extra credit questions), 3 very easy quizzes...all you have to do is show up, listen to his extremely well-structured lectures, and take notes.  He takes a usually dry subject and makes it fun and interesting!

He's awesome. Pretty much all you need to do is go to class and write down everything that he says and you'll do fine. I've gotten high A's on all his tests and quizzes. On top of that he's just a really nice guy. I'd take him again if i could!
I would recommend him to anyone. Go to class and write down EVERYTHING.

Prof. Zander is a great lecturer. When I started this class I had no interest in History, I felt the subject was boring. He presents the material in a fun and interesting format. He is extreamly personable and connects with the students.
No Comments

I had him Summer '08. He was a great professor! He made the class interesting. he even outlines what he's lecturing about and gives you the terms to look for in the lecture. He made it as interesting as possible. It would have been easy if I made it to that 8 a.m. class. Take him if you can!

Attendance isn't mandatory, but he gave us a 40 point (about 10%) "participation" grade. He lectures a lot (don't say I didn't warn you), but they are pretty interesting lectures. He tells a lot of fun facts about history and gives a good perspective. He makes it very clear what is important to know and gives study guides.

Fantastic class! His enthusiasm for this subject and his knowledge about everything kept me enthralled all semester! Even with the hectic summer semester schedule, his lectures were clear and concise and his review sheets for tests were excellent. It would be hard to fail this class as long as you attend lectures and study the review sheets!

=) He's so cute. He sips on his coffee every lecture. Zander has a passion for history. I do not, but I enjoyed the class. NOTES NOTES NOTES & more NOTES... =) however, on the tests, he just wanted to know that you had the main concepts down...which I loved. He made history not as intimidating & portrayed it like a story. =) I def. recommend him!

This is one of the best teachers I have ever encountered.  If you have the chance it will be your pleasure to be instructed by him.  I actually had him at Reinhardt not Kennesaw.  He is passionate about his subject and is very interesting.  Every member of our class was in agreement about his excellence in teaching.  Wish there were more like him.
